thread.title: Man caught smuggling 12 bars of gold in his rectum after airport officials noticed he was walking strangely
thread.title_full: Man caught smuggling 12 bars of gold in his rectum after airport officials noticed he was walking strangely

author: Yahoo News UK
title: Man caught smuggling 12 bars of gold in his rectum after airport officials noticed he was walking strangely
text:
View photos
The man was arrested by customs officials at Hyderabad airport, India (Rex) More That has got to hurt.
A man has been arrested after Indian customs officials found he tried to smuggle 12 bars of gold inside his bottom.
The man was arrested at the Rajiv Gandhi airport in Hyderabad because he was walking in a suspicious manner.
He had inserted the gold bars before setting off on a four-and-a-half hour flight from Singapore.
MORE: Eating less key to ageing more slowly
MORE: Japan’s marriage sex crisis
Officials also found eight gold bars weighing a total of 800 grams hidden inside LED lights after searching his bags.
In total, the Indian smuggler was carrying 2kg of gold worth an estimated £70,000.
“A smuggler bringing gold pieces concealed in his rectum is often an expert,” said a customs official, reported the Mail.
“That’s because not anyone can move with ease when gold pieces are in the rear.”
One gold smuggler, not involved in this week’s operation, and known only as Sajilal, told the Daily Express, the maximum amount any smuggler should attempt to carry internally is 800g. – broken into pieces.
View photos
Officials were alerted by his ‘suspicious’ walking (Rex) More He said: ‘We practice carrying the gold and try walking and sitting normally to avoid customs officials.
‘Food or water is a strict no during assignments. There are a few exercises we do that make work easier and help us carry more gold.
